reviews.text:
Best Temple in Lakhisarai. If you come to Lakhisarai must visit this Mahadev Temple. Very clean and spiritually moment. People come here from far and far areas for Darshan and Abhishek.
In this temple premises A wall and big courtyard and Parvati temple ji temple also.

Recommended for immediate wish completion.
The vibrations are real divine. And marriage also occur and have its own hall.

Beautiful temple with so calm surrounding environment, sometimes feels like you are in meditation.
Har Har Mahadev 🙏
Very neat &clean,well maintained. Became excited to have darshan of Lord Shiva.

Well Maintained Temple 🛕 The Shiva temple I visited was a serene and spiritually uplifting experience. The majestic architecture, peaceful ambiance, and engaging evening aarti ceremony left a lasting impression. The well-maintained premises and friendly staff added to the overall positive experience. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a connection with the divine.

places_with_reviews.name: Ashok Dham Chouki ( ward no 1) Lakhisarai

reviews.text: Awesome temple of lord Shiv on NH-80 in Lakhisarai dist. The temple is well maintained and has certain mini temples of several other gods and goddesses in the premises. Worth visiting.

One of the biggest shivling. The shivling is syambhu means self incarnated. It's a nice and clean temple. You can also conduct various events like shaadi, mundan , movie shooting , photography shooting. It has neat and clean premises

Very beautiful and holy place felling very 😌 calm,just when you enter you will feel like you enter in heaven and lots of beautiful temples are there, they are so huge in size and lots of shops are there for shopping of traditional indian items and worship items very nice experience 🤩🤩🤩

The history of this place is many centuries old, though the structure standing now has been built recently only. The excavation here has surfaced many age old stone idols and structures which have been housed for demonstration in a museum. The priest said there was a Lotus above which the shiva Linga got established. This might be an indication of fight between Shaiva(followers of Shiva and mostly meat eaters) and Vaishnav(followers of Vishnu and the vegetarians who later practiced Buddhism principally) in which Shaiva came out victors and built the shiva temple above the lotus the sign of Vaishnava.

The area is regarded a sacred place for Hindus, clean, big temples. Photography inside the main temple is prohibited. A religious place to visit if you are around Lakhisarai
One of the greatest temple 😍😍😍 very good, awsome
Nice place for peace worship
Best 👍🏻

places_with_reviews.name: Vidyapeeth Chowk
places_with_reviews.address: Vidyapeeth Chowk, 54Q4+VVF, SH 8, near Uninor Office, Lakhisarai, Bihar 811311, India

reviews.text: Vidyapeeth Chowk in Lakhisarai, Bihar, is a vibrant hub teeming with energy. From its bustling market to the aroma of local delicacies, it captures the essence of Bihar's culture. Friendly locals, diverse shops, and delicious street food make it a must-visit destination. Truly an experience worth savoring!
Vidyapeeth Chowk Lakhisarai, From where you can go into four different directions.
Parking problem and jaam is permanent
Good

When ever you visit Shringi Rishi.
You will be feel like you are in heaven.

places_with_reviews.address: 534W+V42 Bari Durga Mandir, Lakhisarai, Bihar 811311, India

reviews.text: Very Holy place you will find so much peace and feel connected to god

Amazing...If ever go there must visit on 1st floor😍😍

Jai Mata Di🙏🙏

Historic Maa Durga Devi Goddess temple. Good space in the middle. Known as Bari Devi in Lakhisarai. But it's in the middle of market or nearby chowk. Maybe it's helpful to some people to easily finding. Bt it could be somewhere else where environment will be more peaceful & calm.

Very old and beautiful temple of maa Durga in Naya bazar area. Nice place to visit especially during Durga pooja festival. This place is usually crowded during Durga pooja festival.  Architecture and building style of the temple is marvellous.

It is a Mandir of Durga Devi. Very popular and crowded Mandir of Lakhisarai, Bihar. Mostly crowded during the festive season like on Durga Puja etc. It is situated little away from Lakhisarai railway station and at the centre of Lakhisarai Bazaar.
Mandir boundary is small.

It's a holi place. People worship to goddess Durga. Visit here only between 6am to 11am.
5pm to10pm.
Maa durga temple. Nice decorated temple.
